content: Who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, which includes the famous scene of God reaching out to touch Adam's finger?

That's Michelangelo Buonarroti, one of the greatest artists of the Renaissance period. He was not only a painter but also a sculptor, architect, and poet. The Sistine Chapel's ceiling is indeed his most renowned work, and the scene you're referring to is part of his series of frescoes that depict various scenes from the Book of Genesis, including the Creation of Adam, where God and Adam reach out to each other symbolizing the imparting of the spark of life. It's an iconic image that has been reproduced and parodied countless times in popular culture.
